body:
Hi @rotobash thanks for submitting an issue.

I have reproduced the error - it is due to `target` tensor not being transferred to GPU.

Also, perhaps a better API design would be to allow users to explicitly set a device to use, rather than automatically using GPU if available.

I'm working on it and will open a PR soon :)

Hi again @rotobashm, the fix has been merged and the updated package is published as `v0.0.8` ([release note](https://github.com/MisaOgura/flashtorch/releases/tag/v0.0.8)).

Let me know whether the issue gets solved, so I can close this :)

Hey @InstantWindy,

I haven't got around to build a proper API guide just yet, but it's definitely on my mind & to-do list :)

As a quick workaround, I've included output of `help` function in the [Quick API Guide](https://github.com/MisaOgura/flashtorch/wiki/Quick-API-Guide) wiki page, which is also reference in [README](https://github.com/MisaOgura/flashtorch#api-guide).

Hope this helps!

Hi @MisaOgura, so sorry for the delay I hadn't had a chance to look at this till now. This seems to solve the cuda transfer issue for the one model I tried, I'll try some other models when I get a chance and let you know if I run into any issues. Thanks for the fix!
Brilliant @rotobash - I would love to see `flashtorch` being used in other projects, and would love to list them on README in the future. So please do let me know how yours goes :)

Hi @farshidrayhan,

FlashTorch supports Python 3.6 and 3.7 - from the stack trace it looks like the environment you're running uses Python 3.5.

Please use supported versions of Python. If you still encounter issues after that, please open another issue.

Thanks!

Hey @thedatalass :)

Is it the link on the README? I just tried it and it seems to be working.

Can you let me know the steps to reproduce the issue so I can address it?

Many thanks!
It is working now for me. Thanks!

Hi @rbunn80110,

Thanks for giving flashtorch a go.

I tested ` flashtorch.backprop.calculate_gradients` with the pre-trained resnet152 model (no additional training) from `torchvision` and it seems to work fine. It might be to do with how you are loading your custom weights onto the model. Can you post the snippets?

FYI my current environment uses `torch 1.2.0` & `torchvision 0.4.0`.

Many thanks,
Misa

Hi @Xestph,

Thanks for submitting a PR.

The default encoding in Python 3 is UTF-8 (https://docs.python.org/3/howto/unicode.html#python-s-unicode-support).

I'd like to diagnose what is causing the error first, so please open an issue with details of your environment such as Python version and locale, as well as relevant code snippets.

I'm happy to reopen this PR once we establish the need for it.

Many thanks,
Misa

Hi @rbunn80110,

Closing this issue for now as there has been no activity.

Please re-open it with information on how you are loading your custom model with relevant code snippets, if this is still an issue.

Many thanks,
Misa
for some reason it does not appear on my github, I edited only one badge, but it does not show on my github.

Thanks @XKMar, And yes, `GradientAscent` works with ResNet. For the models that doesn't come with `features`/`classifier` separation, please pass in the _whole model_ when you create an instance. Then find a conv layer of your interest and specify it when invoking `visualize` method. Hope below snippet helps: Please reopen this issue if this doesn't answer your question. Many thanks, Misa

Hi @vainaijr, No worries, the notebook preview on GitHub doesn't often load. As you can see below, for both `activation_maximization_colab.ipynb` and `activation_maximization.ipynb`, there are 2 badges: My preference is to keep one which links to the notebook from this repo. i.e. `https://colab.research.google.com/github/MisaOgura/flashtorch/blob/master/examples/activation_maximization_colab.ipynb`. Many thanks, Misa

I added only one badge, but it shows two, I raised an issue on colab

![Screenshot (455)](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/43755000/65252234-915b3700-db33-11e9-8e5f-06d2f7f4ec1a.png)
![Screenshot (456)](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/43755000/65252235-915b3700-db33-11e9-8f86-40116f462c18.png)

it turns out that if I save it from colab, then open in colab badge gets added automatically, so no need to specify it once again, therefore, two badges were appearing.

Hi @vainaijr,

Great, I can see that now the notebooks have one button.

One final request - can you change both links to `https://colab.research.google.com/github/MisaOgura/flashtorch/blob/master/examples/activation_maximization_colab.ipynb`, as the both links should redirect users to the colab version of the notebook on the master branch of this repository.

Many thanks,
Misa
I had to edit through jupyter notebook, I think it will work now.
All good @vainaijr, thanks for your contribution.

Hi @vainaijr,

I would need more information in order to diagnose:

e.g. the model architecture, how you are instantiating the `GradientAscent` object etc,

Please also provide any other information you think would be useful.

Many thanks,
Misa

Thanks @vainaijr,

`GradientAscent` is fairly architecture-agnostic.

For certain types of architecture, especially if the liner layers are interwoven and hence can't be separated, you might have to set the `img_size` to what the model expects. The default is `img_size=224`.

You can do so by passing it in on the object instantiation or by reassigning the attribute.

I.e.

```
g_ascent = GradientAscent(model, img_size=int)
```

Or

```
g_ascent.img_size = int
```

Let me know how it goes.

Many thanks,
Misa

it started working, thanks
![Screenshot (465)](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/43755000/65502353-976b6200-defd-11e9-880a-401c618de1f4.png)
That's great @vainaijr, looking forward to hearing what insights you gain with FlashTorch.

Hi @huaji0353 

Thanks for the bug report.

I think it would be probably better to remove the dependency on the `README`, so this doesn't happen again.

The fix will come shortly.

Many thanks,
Misa

Hi @huaji0353 

I've released a fix as a version `0.1.1`.

Can you try to install this version, and let me know if the bug has been fixed?

Many thanks,
Misa

Hi @XKMar 

Thanks for the suggestion, and I think it's a great idea.

I would appreciate if you could:

- give the issue a concise title
- fill out the questions in the template, with as much detail as you can give to explain how you envision this feature

If you don't have detailed specifications yet, please close the issue.

I'm happy to discuss further on the [Gitter community channel](https://gitter.im/flashtorch/community).

Many thanks,
Misa

Successfully installed flashtorch-0.1.1

it work！
Facing the same error. I tried using ResNet50 instead of AlexNet and got the same issue as you. However, using AlexNet works just fine.
I have avoided this error by turning on the requires_grad=True, but the packages still does not work fully for me, so I am not sure if this solved the problem.
I have a PR ready. But don't have permission to push to the repo.
